texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Forwarding X over ssh is normally fairly straightforward when you have the correct packages installed. I have  another post  about the errors that appear when you're missing the  xorg-x11-xauth  (CentOS, Fedora, RHEL) or  xauth  (Debian, Ubuntu) packages.
texts.text: Forwarding X over ssh is normally fairly straightforward when you have the correct packages installed. I have  another post  about the errors that appear when you're missing the  xorg-x11-xauth  (CentOS, Fedora, RHEL) or  xauth  (Debian, Ubuntu) packages.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Today's error was a bit different. Each time I accessed a particular Debian server via ssh with X forwarding requested, I saw this:
texts.text: Today's error was a bit different. Each time I accessed a particular Debian server via ssh with X forwarding requested, I saw this:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
$ ssh -YC myserver.example.com
X11 forwarding request failed on channel 0
texts.text:
$ ssh -YC myserver.example.com
X11 forwarding request failed on channel 0

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The  xauth  package was installed and I found a  .Xauthority  file in root's home directory. Removing the  .Xauthority  file and reconnecting via ssh didn't help. After some searching, I stumbled upon a  GitHub gist  that had some suggestions for fixes.
texts.text: The  xauth  package was installed and I found a  .Xauthority  file in root's home directory. Removing the  .Xauthority  file and reconnecting via ssh didn't help. After some searching, I stumbled upon a  GitHub gist  that had some suggestions for fixes.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: On this particular server, IPv6 was disabled. That caused the error. The quickest fix was to restrict sshd to IPv4 only by adding this line to  /etc/ssh/sshd_config :
texts.text: On this particular server, IPv6 was disabled. That caused the error. The quickest fix was to restrict sshd to IPv4 only by adding this line to  /etc/ssh/sshd_config :

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I restarted the ssh daemon and I was able to forward X applications over ssh once again.
texts.text: I restarted the ssh daemon and I was able to forward X applications over ssh once again.
